meanings.definition: The state of being drowsy or sleepy.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of work, somnolences overtook him, and he drifted off to sleep on the couch.
meanings.sent2: Her somnolences during the boring lecture made it hard for her to stay awake.
meanings.sent3: The somnolences of the cat were evident as it dozed off in the warm sun.
meanings.sent4: The somnolences of the old town gave it a peaceful, sleepy charm.
meanings.sent5: The somnolences of the baby were adorable as it yawned and rubbed its eyes.

meanings.definition: A tendency to fall asleep easily.
meanings.sent1: His somnolences were so strong that he would often doze off in the middle of conversations.
meanings.sent2: The medication side effect caused somnolences, making it hard for the patient to stay awake.
meanings.sent3: The somnolences of the sloth are well-known, as they spend most of their time sleeping in trees.
meanings.sent4: The somnolences of the night enveloped him, and he fell into a deep slumber.
meanings.sent5: The somnolences of the cozy bed beckoned to her, promising a peaceful nap.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being somnolent.
meanings.sent1: The somnolences of the room were palpable, with everyone feeling the urge to yawn.
meanings.sent2: His somnolences were evident as he struggled to keep his eyes open during the movie.
meanings.sent3: The somnolences of the teddy bear made it the perfect companion for nap time.
meanings.sent4: The somnolences of the rainy afternoon made it ideal for a cozy nap.
meanings.sent5: The somnolences of the library were so strong that even the librarian struggled to stay awake.
